They are examining challenges in the marine, automotive, leather, and textile sectors.

articles.summary: Niti Aayog urges India to cut tariffs and boost manufacturing in high-demand sectors like passenger vehicles to enhance global competitiveness. The policy think tank emphasizes increasing two-way trade and integrating deeper into global supply chains. Focusing on automotive exports, the report highlights the need for quality improvements and market diversification to capture a larger share of the growing global market.

The Ministry of Electronics and IT (Meity) has issued a notice to the Chief […]

articles.title: Indian Parliament in 2025: From VB-G RAM G to Waqf and Constitution amendment — Key bills that sparked debate
articles.summary: While the government did not accept the Opposition's demand for an urgent Parliament session after the Pahalgam terror attack, the discussions on it and Operation Sindoor remained a highlight of 2025. Take a look at key bills that made the Parliament roar with heated debates.

articles.title: Recognition, funding, autonomy. Educationists divided over single higher education regulator Bill
articles.summary: Vikshit Bharat Shiksha Adhishthan Bill proposes setting up an overarching higher education commission along with 3 councils for regulation, accreditation & standards of universities.

articles.title: Cabinet clears Bill to merge UGC, AICTE & NCTE; likely to be introduced in Parliament next week
articles.summary: Higher Education Commission of India Bill will establish a sole authority for coordinating & determining standards in higher education, research, and scientific & technical institutions.

articles.title: Tobacco stocks tank in early trade; Godfrey Phillips down 10%
articles.summary: From February 1, pan masala, cigarettes, tobacco and similar products will attract a GST rate of 40%, while ‘beedi' will attract 18% Goods and Services Tax (GST), according to a government notification

articles.title: Additional excise duty on tobacco, health cess on pan masala to be effective February 1
articles.summary: From February 1, pan masala, cigarettes, tobacco and similar products will attract a GST rate of 40%, while biris will attract 18% Goods and Services Tax (GST), according to a government notification

articles.title: Payments Regulatory Board: RBI charts vision for 2028 in first meeting
articles.summary: Members discussed the draft Payments Vision 2028, providing strategic guidance to further develop India’s fast-growing digital payment ecosystem where transaction volumes are projected to nearly triple by FY30.

articles.title: IBBI revamps liquidation forms to cut compliance burden on IPs
articles.summary: The Insolvency Bankruptcy Board of India has introduced new electronic forms for liquidation processes. These revised forms aim to simplify compliance for insolvency professionals and enhance the accuracy of regulatory submissions. The changes will streamline data requirements and utilize technology for auto-population. Four forms, LIQ-1 to LIQ-4, will cover the entire liquidation journey.

articles.title: SIR row: EC tells SC it has power to undertake electoral roll revision; addresses NRC concerns
articles.summary: The Election Commission informed the Supreme Court of its power and constitutional competence to conduct a Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls to exclude foreigners. Appearing for the EC, senior advocate Rakesh Dwivedi argued that citizenship is a foundational requirement for holding public office and that the Constitution mandates the removal of non-citizens from voter lists.

articles.title: Musk's AI chatbot faces global backlash over sexualised images of women and children
articles.summary: Elon Musk's AI chatbot Grok is facing a backlash from governments around the world after a recent surge in sexualized images of women and children generated without consent by the artificial intelligence-powered tool. On Tuesday, Britain's top technology official demanded that Musk's social media platform X take urgent action while a Polish lawmaker cited it as a reason to enact digital safety laws.

articles.title: Tariff uncertainty clouds India’s spring-summer export season as US orders hang in balance
articles.summary: Tariff: For now, Indian exporters are holding the line, sharing costs with buyers and hoping that policy will catch up with commercial reality. The urgency, however, is deepening, and if clarity does not emerge soon, the impact may be felt not just in balance sheets, but in jobs and livelihoods.

articles.title: Delhi's EV policy 2.0: Govt to pay owners of old fuel cars for conversion into EVs, check new policy measures
articles.summary: The Delhi government has introduced a new vehicle rule aimed at reducing air pollution. It will provide a Rs 50,000 subsidy for the first 1,000 cars that need modifying to push people to convert their diesel/petrol cars into electric vehicles (EVs). The move is beneficial for those considering scraping or dumping their old vehicles as they would now receive an upgraded version of their old car along with an incentive.

articles.title: Dalal Street's Jan Dhan: PSU stocks are great again
articles.summary: State-run companies are emerging as top long-term wealth creators again, with 26 PSUs featuring among the top 100 between April 2020 and March 2025. This marks a significant turnaround from previous years, driven by factors like government divestment policy changes and a focus on sectors like defence and utilities.

articles.title: Board of Payments Regulatory Board holds its first meet, reviews draft Payments Vision 2028
articles.summary: The Board reviewed the functions of the Department of Payment and Settlement Systems and current focus areas covering both domestic and global payment systems. The draft Payments Vision 2028 was presented, and Members gave strategic guidance to ensure the continued development of India's payment ecosystem, RBI said in a statement.

articles.title: Govt. notifies February 1 as the end of GST compensation cess, start of new tobacco tax regime
articles.summary: In a series of notifications on New Year’s Day, the Finance Ministry announced the end of GST compensation cess, the increase in the excise duty on tobacco products, and the new GST rates on these items as well

articles.title: UP: CM reviews progress of Mission Karmayogi
articles.summary: Lucknow, Jan 6 (PTI) Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath on Tuesday conducted a comprehensive review of the progress achieved so far under Mission Karmayogi and the forthcoming action plan. At a high-level meeting, detailed discussions were held on the implementation of the mission, training infrastructure, status of digital platforms and capacity-building initiatives across various […]

articles.title: Ramesh Juneja assumes charge as Chairman of Council for Leather Exports
articles.summary: Ramesh Juneja has taken over as the new Chairman of the Council for Leather Exports. The organization sees significant growth potential for India's leather and footwear exports. Bilateral trade agreements with the EU and US could boost exports to $14 billion in the next 3-5 years. Currently, exports stand at around $5.5 billion.

articles.title: Supreme Court criticises air quality panel for ‘unserious’ approach towards pollution in Delhi
articles.summary: The Commission for Air Quality Management did not appear to be in a hurry to identify the causes of worsening air quality or formulate solutions, it said.

articles.title: RBI issues amendment directions on related-party lending, allows non-compliant transactions with conditions
articles.summary: RBI will issue new lending rules for banks, NBFCs, cooperative banks, and AIFIs, tightening related-party transactions, disclosure norms, and introducing materiality thresholds from April 1, 2026.

articles.title: Bond market update: Yields steady as markets await GDP data, index inclusion
articles.summary: In the secondary market, state-owned banks were active buyers, picking up government securities worth around ₹92.5 billion.

articles.summary: New Delhi, Jan 4 (PTI) Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal will visit Brussels this week for talks with his EU counterpart on the proposed trade pact, for which negotiations are in the last phase, an official said. During the two-day visit on January 8-9, Goyal will meet the Executive Vice-President and European Commissioner for […]

articles.title: ‘Gross violation of AI’: MeitY gives X 72 hours to remove ‘unlawful’ content, warns legal action
articles.summary: The government has demanded that X undertake a comprehensive and immediate technical review of Grok including how it processes prompts and creation capabilities so as to not facilitate sexually explicit, unlawful content.

articles.title: MeitY takes cognisance of Grok misuse on X, action to follow soon: Secretary S Krishnan
articles.summary: The electronics and IT ministry has begun examining the alleged misuse of X’s AI tool Grok to generate obscene and non-consensual images, with MeitY Secretary S Krishnan indicating that regulatory action could be taken swiftly as scrutiny intensifies around platform accountability and AI safety.

articles.title: India, EU crucial FTA talks on Jan 8-9 in Brussels; Goyal to meet Maros Sefcovic
articles.summary: India and the European Union are set to hold ministerial-level discussions in Brussels on January 8-9 to finalize their proposed free trade agreement. Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal will meet with EU Commissioner Maros Sefcovic to resolve pending issues and expedite the conclusion of a balanced and ambitious pact.

articles.title: RBI set for further easing — 50 bps cut possible in 2026: Report
articles.summary: India's central bank may cut policy rates by another 50 basis points in 2026. This follows significant reductions in 2025. The gap between the repo rate and core inflation provides room for more easing. Economic reforms and rate cuts are expected to boost GDP growth. Banks are poised for better performance as credit conditions improve.

articles.title: Budget 2026 could simplify income tax rules for global mergers involving Indian firms
articles.summary: India Budget 2026: India's integration with global markets faces tax challenges in overseas restructurings. Current tax laws create unintended taxability for shareholders of foreign companies holding Indian assets during mergers. Amendments are needed to ensure tax neutrality for such cross-border reorganizations, aligning with India's goal of becoming a global business hub.

articles.title: Should Budget 2026 put India’s data centre backbone at the centre of its AI ambitions?
articles.summary: Union Budget 2026: India's ambition of becoming a leading global player in artificial intelligence needs a strong policy push in data centre development. The upcoming Union Budget 2026 serves as a crucial turning point for catalysing growth. Industry players note the importance of improved energy access, expedited regulatory approvals, and well-defined policies for the long haul.

articles.title: Government withdraws import restrictions on low ash met coke with ash content below 18%
articles.summary: The Directorate General of Foreign Trade (DGFT), on January 3, amended the import policy of Low Ash Metallurgical Coke, having ash content below 18%, including coke fines/coke breeze and ultra-low phosphorous metallurgical coke, to “free” from “restricted” earlier.

articles.title: India likely to retain 4% inflation target for central bank, Bloomberg News reports
articles.summary: India is expected to maintain its current inflation target for the Reserve Bank of India, with officials deeming the flexible framework effective. The target mandates 4% inflation within a 2% to 6% band, a policy due for renewal in March. This approach, adopted in 2016, has seen inflation remain within the band for most of the past decade.

articles.title: ​Unenviable choice: On the government’s fiscal policy space
articles.summary: Growth-generating capital expenditure can affect fiscal targets

articles.title: The Tencent-Flipkart test: Is New Delhi about to ease up on Chinese investment?
articles.summary: The government is weighing a proposal to exempt investments up to 26% from the rigorous security screening process mandated by PN(3), provided the foreign entity exercises no management control and holds no seat on the company’s board, two people familiar with the matter said.

articles.title: ED raids climate advocacy group for alleged violations of foreign exchange rules
articles.summary: The agency said it suspects that Satat Sampada Private Limited received foreign funds to ‘run narratives’ to influence the government’s energy policy.

articles.title: India-US trade talks, Trump and the China factor: Why New Delhi’s foreign policy faces its toughest test in 2026
articles.summary: As geopolitical fault lines deepen, former Indian diplomats warn that stalled trade talks with Washington reflect a broader strategic shift, forcing New Delhi to rethink how it balances the US, China and its own economic interests in a volatile global environment.

articles.summary: Computer-based tests, if used, should be conducted only in government-controlled centres, a Digvijay Singh-led Standing Committee has said in Parliament.

articles.title: Union Budget: 5 engines India must fire to become a developed nation by 2047
articles.summary: India Budget: India's 2047 developed nation dream hinges on a multi-pronged growth strategy, with the upcoming Budget playing a crucial role. Key focus areas include empowering MSMEs, leveraging technology for efficient governance, bolstering infrastructure, increasing women's workforce participation, and boosting high-value manufacturing. These initiatives are vital for sustained economic progress.

articles.title: NMC withdraws Mata Vaishno Devi varsity’s MBBS list with 42 Muslim candidates citing 'non-compliance'; BJP welcomes move
articles.summary: Officials said the NMC’s Medical Assessment and Rating Board withdrew the Letter of Permission granted to the varsity in Reasi for running the MBBS course with 50 seats for 2025-26

An order issued by the MARB on Tuesday said all students admitted to […]

articles.title: EC Competent to Conduct SIR of Electoral Rolls: Poll Panel to SC
articles.summary: The Supreme Court is hearing challenges against the Election Commission's decision to revise electoral rolls, raising critical questions about citizenship and voting rights in India.

articles.title: PM Modi reviews progress on overseas critical mineral acquisitions, ₹1,500-crore recycling incentive scheme
articles.summary: The review covered India’s efforts to secure long-term access to key minerals such as lithium, cobalt and rare earths, while scaling up domestic recycling capacity to reduce import dependence and support manufacturing under the Make in India programme.

articles.title: Wipro now mandates six hours WFO in hybrid work tweak
articles.summary: Software exporter Wipro has tightened its work-from-office policy, mandating employees to stay at least six hours in office for three days a week, in a shift from the earlier flexible hours. While weekly three days of attendance at the office has been in place for some time, the six hours of stay between two in and out punches is among the additions to Wipro’s hybrid work policy in India.

articles.title: Piyush Goyal’s two-day visit to EU to give decisive push to conclude FTA
articles.summary: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal will visit Brussels from January 8-9 to meet EU Commissioner Maroš Šefčovič, aiming to expedite the conclusion of the India-EU Free Trade Agreement. The discussions will focus on resolving outstanding issues and securing tangible benefits for India's labor-intensive sectors.

articles.title: Tariff cut, reorientation of production to enhance global competitiveness: Niti Aayog
articles.summary: Niti Aayog recommends strategic steps for India to boost its global standing. Key measures include lowering tariffs and shifting production to popular segments like passenger vehicles. Strengthening quality standards and technology adoption are also vital. India's automotive exports have opportunities to grow in the global market.

articles.title: Budget 2026: Rice exporters seek support to offset impact of rising cost, environmental stress
articles.summary: As Budget 2026 approaches, India's rice export industry is making the case that competitiveness and sustainability must move together. For a sector that feeds global markets and supports millions at home, exporters say the policy choices made now will shape India’s role in the rice trade for years to come.

articles.title: Samsung, SK Hynix, Micron shares rise as investors turn to memory chipmakers amid global supply crunch
articles.summary: Memory chip stocks are surging as investors anticipate further price increases. A global supply shortage, fueled by booming demand for artificial intelligence infrastructure, is driving this trend. Industry leaders describe the situation as unprecedented, with constraints expected to last for years. This demand is diverting manufacturing capacity, impacting supply for other sectors.

articles.title: Mint Explainer: Why Trump's Venezuela shock is fueling gold, not crude
articles.summary: US action in Venezuela has revived fears over geopolitics, sovereignty, and the safety of paper reserves. While oil prices remain constrained by supply realities, gold is increasingly pricing in a more fragmented and coercive global order.

articles.title: Sebi mulls ending market education price data confusion with 30-day lag
articles.summary: The market regulator has proposed a uniform 30-day delay in using price data for investor education to remove regulatory ambiguity exposed by its crackdown on stock market educators.

articles.title: India launches anti-dumping probe into nylon-6 chip imports from China, Russia
articles.summary: India has started an anti-dumping probe into nylon-6 chips from China and Russia, prompted by domestic manufacturers' concerns over cheap imports affecting local industry. The investigation will evaluate the implications for pricing and market stability in the synthetic raw materials sector.

articles.title: 35% of issues in big projects due to land acquisition; no plan to change law: Cabinet Secretary Somanathan
articles.summary: Update from Indian Express - Business

articles.title: Jharkhand joins Punjab, Karnataka in opposing Centre’s new VB-G RAM G Act
articles.summary: The Jharkhand government has hardened its stance against the Centre’s new rural employment framework, with Chief Minister Hemant Soren warning that any changes undermining wage security, work guarantees and state autonomy could worsen livelihood stress and migration in tribal and rural regions.

articles.title: Govt removes import restrictions on low-ash metallurgical coke
articles.summary: The government has removed import restrictions on lowash metallurgical coke, having ash content below 18%, according to a notification.

articles.title: Large taxpayers may soon have fully automated tax compliance systems
articles.summary: The central government has begun granting API access to tax portals, paving the way for AI-led automation tools for filings and compliance.

articles.title: Historic Financial Reset for Delhi: Delhi government under the leadership of CM Rekha Gupta signs transformational MoU with RBI
articles.summary: Chief Minister Rekha Gupta, who also holds the Finance portfolio in the Delhi Government, described the MoU as a transformational milestone and a long-overdue reform that previous governments failed to initiate.

articles.title: No plan to change land acquisition policy, says cabinet secretary T V Somanathan
articles.summary: Officials said the PRAGATI platform has helped unlock stalled investments by resolving issues linked to land, environment and right of way, enabling large road, rail and power projects to move forward despite persistent structural challenges.

articles.title: Finding growth without overpaying is the real task now, says Axis MF's Shreyash Devalkar
articles.summary: Axis Mutual Fund’s Shreyash Devalkar said Indian equities are facing valuation pressure as most investment themes are already priced in. He is focusing on growth continuity and GARP opportunities, especially in potential turnaround sectors such as banks, lending, and parts of autos. He highlighted risks in high-valuation sectors, evolving consumption patterns in QSRs, and said inflation and policy cues will be key factors to track going ahead.

articles.title: 1 regulator, 3 councils: Inside Viksit Bharat Shiksha Adhishthan Bill for higher education overhaul
articles.summary: Modi govt is set to introduce bill that proposes umbrella body for higher education, councils for regulation, accreditation. It will be headed by a chairperson appointed by the President.

articles.title: Bangladesh existence can't be imagined without 1971 war: BNP acting chairperson Tarique Rahman
articles.summary: BNP acting chairperson Tarique Rahman emphasized the 1971 Liberation War as the bedrock of Bangladesh's existence and politics. He urged national unity and collaboration between government and opposition to leverage the post-election "uprising" for strengthening democracy and building a liberal, welfare-oriented state with people at its core.

articles.title: India initiates anti-dumping probe into imports of nylon chips from China, Russia
articles.summary: India's Directorate General of Trade Remedies (DGTR) has launched an anti-dumping probe into nylon chips and granules imports from China and Russia. A domestic manufacturer alleged that dumping of Nylon 6 Chips and Granules with relative viscosity below 3 is harming the local industry. The DGTR found prima facie evidence and will recommend duties if material injury is established.

articles.title: Evening news wrap: SC raps air quality body over Delhi pollution; JNU seeks FIR on students over anti-Modi slogans and more
articles.summary: The Supreme Court has criticized the CAQM for its inaction on Delhi's air pollution, ordering a meeting with experts within two weeks to devise long-term solutions. Meanwhile, Prithviraj Chavan made a controversial statement linking US operations in Venezuela to potential threats against India's Prime Minister.

articles.title: How US attack on Venezuela impacts India's stock market, crude oil bill, economy
articles.summary: The US attack on Venezuela is creating a dichotomy of sorts for India, as the regime change is less about macroeconomics and more about hard cash.

articles.title: Thiruparankundram Deepam Row: BJP Accuses DMK of Bias as Government Moves Supreme Court
articles.summary: Thiruparankundram Deepam Row: BJP Accuses DMK of Bias as Government Moves Supreme Court

articles.title: FTA with India to boost exports and open doors for farmers, businesses: New Zealand PM Christopher Luxon
articles.summary: New Zealand and India have concluded a Free Trade Agreement. This pact is set to boost exports and create jobs for New Zealand. The deal aims to enhance market access and promote investment. It is expected to take effect in seven to eight months. This agreement signifies a significant step in strengthening bilateral economic ties between the two nations.

articles.title: Childcare emerges as key HR focus under Social Security Code
articles.summary: India Inc is boosting childcare support as the Social Security Code nears. Nearly 60% of companies have increased budgets for crèches and daycare. This move aims to retain talent and promote workforce diversity. Childcare benefits are now a top HR priority for working parents. The government's initiative strengthens existing provisions for parental support.

articles.title: Mint Explainer: How India’s new export mission targets MSME credit and market gaps
articles.summary: India has launched a ₹25,060-crore Export Promotion Mission to cut MSME export costs, ease credit stress and expand access to overseas buyers amid rising tariffs and global trade uncertainty.

articles.title: Prevention key to tackling human trafficking, says official
articles.summary: Suryakumari stresses early intervention, coordinated implementation of schemes and community awareness at regional Training of Trainers programme in Vijayawada

articles.title: India’s fiscal fault lines between Centre and states return to the spotlight
articles.summary: Recent changes to India's rural job guarantee scheme have brought back into the spotlight long-running disputes between the Union government and states on how financial resources should be shared.

articles.title: Oil India open to more investment in Venezuela, targets higher production in FY27
articles.summary: Oil India CMD Ranjit Rath said the company may increase investment in Venezuela’s Carabobo oil field if production ramps up and confirmed there are no dividend issues linked to sanctions. He said most Russian dividends have been received, drilling activity has increased sharply, and production is expected to rise in FY27. The expanded Numaligarh refinery has begun commissioning, with partial utilisation expected in its first year.

articles.title: Haryana set to witness launch of India's first hydrogen train – All about it
articles.summary: The hydrogen facility at Jind, which will provide fuel for the train during its final commissioning and normal operations, is set to receive reliable and uninterrupted 11 kV power supply.

The Supreme Court on Monday refused to grant bail to activists Umar Khalid and […]

articles.title: Succession law & the ‘2005’ argument: In HC’s ruling, reaffirmation of daughters’ coparcenary rights
articles.summary: Madras HC dismissed a brother’s argument that his sister couldn't claim share in family property because their father had passed away before the 2005 amendment in succession law.

articles.title: Swiggy Instamart partners with YISU to train 5,000 youths in Telangana
articles.summary: The partnership has been formalised through a memorandum of understanding between Instamart and YISU, which was established under the Young India Skills University Telangana Act 2024, the company said in a statement.

articles.title: Lockheed Martin to triple Patriot PAC-3 missile output under seven-year US deal
articles.summary: The expanded manufacturing plan underscores a sustained build-up in air defence spending, with Lockheed Martin aligning capacity with long-term US and allied requirements as governments prioritise missile interception amid escalating security risks.

articles.title: Grok obscene AI content: Govt gives X time till January 7 to submit report
articles.summary: The government has given X additional time till January 7 to submit a detailed Action Taken Report after it issued a stern warning to the Elon Musk-led social media platform over indecent and sexually-explicit content being generated through misuse of AI-based services like 'Grok' and other tools.

articles.title: RBI to take over Delhi government’s banking operations, manage public debt
articles.summary: The Reserve Bank of India will assume responsibility for the Delhi government’s banking operations and rupee public debt from January 9, 2026.

articles.title: Retailers urges consumption-led growth, tax relief and National Retail Policy in Budget 2026–27
articles.summary: Retailers Association of India urges Union Budget 2026–27 to boost consumption, ease credit, simplify GST, support digital payments and enact National Retail Policy to drive growth and employment.

articles.title: India to grow above 7%, rate cut room limited but rupee outlook improves: Citi India
articles.summary: Citi India expects India to grow above 7% in real terms with inflation near 3.8%, leaving room for limited monetary easing. Chief Economist Samiran Chakraborty said the rupee outlook could improve if the balance of payments turns surplus, while the RBI’s focus in 2026 is likely to be on liquidity and policy guidance rather than aggressive rate cuts.

articles.title: New Income Tax Act from April 1: Key changes taxpayers should note
articles.summary: The Indian government will implement the Income Tax Act 2025 from April 1, 2026, with updated rules, digital processes, and support, as highlighted by CBDT Chairman Ravi Agrawal.

articles.title: Gold, silver trends explained: What’s supporting prices at elevated levels
articles.summary: Gold and silver prices rose due to US actions on Venezuela, regional instability, supply concerns, and US policy, say experts.

articles.title: Who is Banojyotsna Lahiri? Jailed student activist and JNU alumni Umar Khalid's partner; shared his response over SC ruling
articles.summary: Student activist and JNU alumni Umar Khalid was denied bail by the Supreme Court in the 2020 Delhi riots CAA protest case on Monday. FMCG volumes saw a significant jump, and analysts predict further acceleration in branded product growth, signaling a strong leap for the sector.

Rubin is made up of six chips, consisting of tightly connected processors and networking components — Vera CPU, Rubin GPU, NVLink 6 Switch, ConnectX-9 Super NIC, BlueField-4 DPU, and Spectrum-6 Ethernet Switch.

articles.title: SuprDaily founder Puneet Kumar quits Nexus Venture Partners to launch new startup

He had joined Nexus as a venture partner in 2024 at a time when several VC firms were roping in founders and senior corporate executives to advise their portfolio companies.

articles.title: TV makers tout AI upgrades at CES, as smartphone threat looms
articles.summary: The proportion of daily viewing on TV sets declined from 61% at the start of 2017 to 48% late last year, according to market tracker Ampere Analysis. Smartphone viewing, meanwhile, nearly doubled over that same period to 21%.

articles.title: Lucid, Nuro, Uber debut robotaxi ahead of launch this year
articles.summary: The unveiling at the CES technology conference in Las Vegas places the trio among a growing group of companies pursuing large-scale robotaxi deployment in the US, alongside ‌Alphabet's Waymo ‌and Elon Musk's Tesla among others.

articles.title: Uber shows off its robotaxi heading for San Francisco
articles.summary: The Uber robotaxis are taking shape through a collaboration with autonomous driving technology firm Nuro and electric vehicle maker Lucid using a platform powered by AI-chip colossus Nvidia.

articles.title: Easing inflation, strong macros to drive FMCG consumption this year
articles.summary: Fast-moving consumer goods consumption is set for a 5% growth in early 2026. Strong economic indicators and rising demand are driving this positive outlook. Consumers are expected to shop more and opt for premium products as prices stabilize. Leading companies like Marico and Dabur are already seeing early signs of recovery.

articles.title: India's services sector growth hits 11-month low in December, PMI shows
articles.summary: India's services sector expansion slowed to an 11-month low in December, with new business growth easing and hiring stalling. While international demand offered a bright spot, business confidence declined, reaching its lowest in over three years. A benign inflation environment, however, bodes well for future competition and job creation.

articles.title: After months of slowdown, consumer demand rebounds in Oct–Dec on GST cuts, softer inflation
articles.summary: Consumer goods demand saw a strong recovery in the October-December quarter, driven by GST cuts and easing inflation. Sales of electronics like ACs and TVs rose significantly, marking the retail market's best growth phase in over 18 months. Retailers remain cautious but inventory levels have decreased.

articles.title: India's urea imports more than double to 7.17 MT in Apr-Nov: FAI data
articles.summary: India’s urea imports more than doubled to 7.17 million tonnes in April–November of the current fiscal year as domestic production fell, according to Fertiliser Association of India data. Imports rose 120% from a year earlier, while domestic urea output declined 3.7% to 19.75 million tonnes. Overall urea sales increased 2.3% to 25.40 million tonnes, indicating higher demand.

articles.title: ET Explainer: Big privacy risks in view as glasses turn AI smart
articles.summary: Apple recently received a patent for its smart glasses, while Meta has already launched its version and Amazon is preparing to enter the market. ​​ According to Apple's patent, the glasses would be equivalent to augmented reality devices rather than merely AI or camera accessories, given that they would visually display information. The future of smart glasses could see a shift towards more visual features, but could also spark greater privacy concerns, with everyday life being recorded.

articles.title: Britain demands Elon Musk's Grok answers concerns about sexualised photos
articles.summary: Britain has demanded Elon Musk's social ‍media site X ​explain how its AI chatbot ⁠Grok was able to produce undressed images of people and sexualised images of children, and whether it was failing ‌in its ‌legal duty to protect users.

articles.title: Kodiak AI teams up with Bosch to scale hardware for self-driving trucks
articles.summary: Kodiak AI announced today its partnership with Bosch to boost the production of self-driving truck technology. Bosch will provide essential automotive-grade components, including sensors and steering systems. The partnership focuses on developing a robust autonomous platform for commercial deployment.

articles.title: Samsung working towards unified AI experience for all products, services: New co-CEO

articles.title: Reddit overtakes TikTok in the UK as Google, Gen Z drive its rise

The site now reaches 60% of UK internet users, with strong growth among young and female audiences. Partnerships with Google and OpenAI, GenZ seeking real advice and plus live sports discussion, have driven traffic.

Beauty saw its fastest growth in the past six quarters, while fashion lagged due to weaker marketing income streams. The update, issued by the company, is provisional and subject to audit, it said in the filing.

articles.title: UGC tells universities to prevent entry of stray dogs in campus, calls for ’round-the-clock vigil’
articles.summary: Direction is in line with SC's 7 November order asking all states/UTs and Centre to secure educational institutions and other public places from stray canines, says UGC.

articles.title: Parsis to Tibetans, India ‘safe haven’ for ‘persecuted communities’ for centuries—new Class 7 NCERT book
articles.summary: Previous NCERT social science textbooks didn't have such a chapter. No connection to CAA controversy, says NCERT director.

articles.title: D K Shivakumar to become Karnataka CM in early January, claims Congress MLA
articles.summary: Fresh comments by a Congress legislator have reignited speculation over a possible leadership transition in Karnataka, even as Chief Minister Siddaramaiah maintains he will continue in office and party leaders cite an internal agreement brokered by the high command.

articles.title: Congress 140th foundation day: Mallikarjun Kharge says Congress is an ideology and 'ideologies never die'
articles.summary: Congress marks 140th Foundation Day as Mallikarjun Kharge highlights its enduring ideology, historic milestones, and commitment to democracy and unity.
